entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The person Harry is going to talk to about his problems. Dumbledore's name is mentioned as a destination for Harry's complaint.

entities.name: filch
entities.description: The caretaker of Hogwarts who has been manning the lookout post and shouting about the flood in the corridor. His name is mentioned as he is seen by Harry, Ron, and Hermione.

entities.name: mrs norris
entities.description: The cat of Argus Filch who was attacked earlier. Her name is mentioned in the context of where the flood has occurred.

entities.name: moaning myrtle
entities.description: A ghost who lives in the girls' bathroom and is known for her crying. Her name is mentioned as she is heard wailing due to the flood in the corridor.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main protagonist of the story who, along with Ron and Hermione, investigates the flood in the corridor. His name is mentioned as he decides to go and see what's up with Myrtle.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Harry's friend who accompanies him to investigate the flood in the corridor. His name is mentioned as he asks 'Now what's up with her?' about Myrtle.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Harry's friend who accompanies him to investigate the flood in the corridor. Her name is not explicitly mentioned, but she is referred to as 'they' along with Harry and Ron.

relationships.description: Harry is going to talk to Dumbledore about his problems. This relationship is mentioned in the first sentence of the passage.
Filch has a cat named Mrs Norris, which is attacked earlier. This relationship is mentioned in the context of where the flood has occurred.
Harry and his friends are concerned about Myrtle due to her wailing. This relationship is mentioned as they decide to go and see what's up with her.
Harry, Ron, and Hermione see Filch manning the lookout post. This relationship is mentioned as they observe what Filch has been shouting about.
Harry and Ron accompany each other to investigate the flood in the corridor. This relationship is mentioned as they decide to go and see what's up with Myrtle.
